intro: Aspicarpa hyssopifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aspicarpa, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Aspicarpa hyssopifolia is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
